greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T, read by rows, that satisfies the recurrence: T(n,k) = [T^3](n-1,k-1) + [T^3](n-1,k) for n>k>=0, with T(n,n)=1 for n>=0, where T^3 is the matrix third power of T.
comment: Column 0 of the matrix power p, T^p, equals the number of 3-tournament sequences having initial term p.
formula: Let GF[T] denote the g.f. of triangular matrix T. Then GF[T] = 1 + x*(1+y)*GF[T^3] and for all integer p>=1: GF[T^p] = 1 + x*Sum_{j=1..p} GF[T^(p+2*j)] + x*y*GF[T^(3*p)].
example: where adjacent sums in row n of T^3 forms row n+1 of T.
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Oct 14 2005
